intro: Zulatia alata, commonly known as the winged zulatia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, often with a bluish-gray hue. Zulatia alata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
